name: Madhubani Painting
description: A famous, intricate style of folk painting characterized by complex geometric patterns.
details: Also known as Mithila painting, this art form is practiced in the Mithila region of Bihar. It is characterized by eye-catching geometrical patterns and is created using natural dyes with fingers, twigs, brushes, and matchsticks.

name: Sikki Grass Craft
description: An ancient craft where Sikki grass is woven into decorative objects and baskets.
details: Sikki grass craft uses golden-hued grass found in marshy areas of Mithila. Artisans coil and stitch the grass to create durable baskets, boxes, and toys decorated with colorful patterns.

name: Tikuli Art
description: A traditional art form involving delicate hand-painting on hardboard with a glossy finish.
details: Tikuli art dates back over 800 years and was originally used to create decorative bindis. Today it features intricate enamel-like paintings depicting mythological and daily life scenes.

name: Sujini Embroidery
description: A traditional quilting and embroidery style depicting narrative village scenes.
details: Sujini embroidery uses old clothes stitched together to create a canvas. Artists use running stitches to narrate stories of folklore, social issues, and daily village life.

name: Manjusha Art
description: A folk art of the Anga region known for its scroll-style paintings.
details: Manjusha art narrates the folklore of Bihula-Vishari using line-based drawings and a limited color palette of pink, green, and yellow.

name: Terracotta Crafts
description: The ancient craft of creating pottery and figures from baked clay.
details: Bihari terracotta art produces household utensils, animal figures, and votive idols. The craft is known for its rustic simplicity and historical roots.

name: Bamboo Craft
description: The skill of creating functional and decorative items from bamboo.
details: Bamboo artisans craft baskets, furniture, fish traps, and decorative pieces, showcasing sustainable use of natural resources.

name: Stone Craft
description: An ancient tradition of stone carving with historical roots in Bihar.
details: Stone carving in Patharkatti dates back to the Mauryan era. Artisans create sculptures, household items, and architectural elements from locally sourced stone.

name: Bidesia Folk Theatre
description: A folk theatre tradition addressing social issues and migration.
details: Created by Bhikhari Thakur, Bidesia combines music, drama, and dance to portray the struggles of migrant workers and rural communities.

name: Dhokra Metal Casting
description: An ancient metal casting technique using the lost-wax method.
details: Dhokra art is practiced for over 4,000 years. Artisans use wax molds to create unique brass figurines with a rustic finish.
